Uses of Class
com.google.mu.util.Retryer.Delay

  • Packages that use Retryer.Delay 
    Package Description
    com.google.mu.util
    Some extra Java 8 utilities.

    • Uses of Retryer.Delay in com.google.mu.util

      Methods in com.google.mu.util with type parameters of type Retryer.Delay 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T extends Retryer.Delay<?>>
      List<T>      		 Retryer.Delay.timed(List<T> list)
      Returns a view of list that while not modifiable, will become empty when duration() has elapsed since the time the view was created as if another thread had just concurrently removed all elements from it.
      <T extends Retryer.Delay<?>>
      List<T>      		 Retryer.Delay.timed(List<T> list, java.time.Clock clock)
      Returns a view of list that while not modifiable, will become empty when duration() has elapsed since the time the view was created as if another thread had just concurrently removed all elements from it.
      Methods in com.google.mu.util that return Retryer.Delay 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Retryer.Delay<E> Retryer.Delay.multipliedBy(double multiplier)
      Returns a new Delay with duration multiplied by multiplier.
      static <E> Retryer.Delay<E> Retryer.Delay.of(java.time.Duration duration)
      Returns a Delay of duration.
      static <E> Retryer.Delay<E> Retryer.Delay.ofMillis(long millis)
      Shorthand for of(Duration.ofMillis(millis)).
      Retryer.Delay<E> Retryer.Delay.randomized(Random random, double randomness)
      Returns a new Delay with some extra randomness.
      Methods in com.google.mu.util that return types with arguments of type Retryer.Delay 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<Retryer.Delay<E>> Retryer.Delay.exponentialBackoff(double multiplier, int size)
      Returns an immutable List of delays with size.
      List<Retryer.Delay<E>> Retryer.Delay.fibonacci(int size)
      Returns a fibonacci list of delays of size, as in 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, ... with this delay being the multiplier.
